refsynopsisdiv.title: Synopsis

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Tooltips are the messages that appear next to a widget when the mouse pointer is held over it for a short amount of time. They are especially helpful for adding more verbose descriptions of things such as buttons in a toolbar.

An individual tooltip belongs to a group of tooltips. A group is created with a call to gtk_tooltips_new(). Every tooltip in the group can then be turned off with a call to gtk_tooltips_disable() and enabled with gtk_tooltips_enable().
The length of time the user must keep the mouse over a widget before the tip is shown, can be altered with gtk_tooltips_set_delay(). This is set on a 'per group of tooltips' basis.
To assign a tip to a particular GtkWidget, gtk_tooltips_set_tip() is used.

note.para: Tooltips can only be set on widgets which have their own X window. To check if a widget has its own window use GTK_WIDGET_NO_WINDOW(). To add a tooltip to a widget that doesn't have its own window, place the widget inside a GtkEventBox and add a tooltip to that instead.

refsect1.para: The default appearance of all tooltips in a program is determined by the current GTK+ theme that the user has selected.
Information about the tooltip (if any) associated with an arbitrary widget can be retrieved using gtk_tooltips_data_get().

example.title: Adding tooltips to buttons.

refsect2.title: struct GtkTooltips
refsect2.para: Holds information about a group of tooltips. Fields should be changed using the functions provided, rather than directly accessing the struct's members.

refsect2.title: struct GtkTooltipsData
refsect2.para: tooltips is the GtkTooltips group that this tooltip belongs to. widget is the GtkWidget that this tooltip data is associated with. tip_text is a string containing the tooltip message itself.

tip_private is a string that is not shown as the default tooltip. Instead, this message may be more informative and go towards forming a context-sensitive help system for your application. (FIXME: how to actually "switch on" private tips?)

refsect2.title: gtk_tooltips_new ()
refsect2.para: Creates an empty group of tooltips. This function initialises a GtkTooltips structure. Without at least one such structure, you can not add tips to your application.

listitem.simpara: a new GtkTooltips group for you to use.

refsect2.title: gtk_tooltips_enable ()
refsect2.para: Allows the user to see your tooltips as they navigate your application.

refsect2.title: gtk_tooltips_disable ()
refsect2.para: Causes all tooltips in tooltips to become inactive. Any widgets that have tips associated with that group will no longer display their tips until they are enabled again with gtk_tooltips_enable().

refsect2.title: gtk_tooltips_set_delay ()

warning.para: gtk_tooltips_set_delay is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Sets the time between the user moving the mouse over a widget and the widget's tooltip appearing.

listitem.simpara: an integer value representing seconds (FIXME: double-check this).

refsect2.title: gtk_tooltips_set_tip ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gtk_tooltips_set_tip (GtkTooltips *tooltips, GtkWidget *widget, const gchar *tip_text, const gchar *tip_private);
refsect2.para: Adds a tooltip containing the message tip_text to the specified GtkWidget.

listitem.simpara: the GtkWidget you wish to associate the tip with.
a string containing the tip itself.
a string of any further information that may be useful if the user gets stuck.

refsect2.title: gtk_tooltips_data_get ()
refsect2.para: Retrieves any GtkTooltipsData previously associated with the given widget.

listitem.simpara: a GtkTooltipsData struct, or NULL if the widget has no tooltip.

refsect2.title: gtk_tooltips_force_window ()
refsect2.para: Ensures that the window used for displaying the given tooltips is created.
Applications should never have to call this function, since GTK+ takes care of this.

refsect2.title: gtk_tooltips_get_info_from_tip_window ()
refsect2.para: Determines the tooltips and the widget they belong to from the window in which they are displayed.
This function is mostly intended for use by accessibility technologies; applications should have little use for it.

listitem.simpara: the return location for the tooltips which are displayed in tip_window, or NULL
the return location for the widget whose tooltips are displayed, or NULL
TRUE if tip_window is displaying tooltips, otherwise FALSE.
